headline: Perfect Every Time Pizza or Calzone Dough
description: This calzone pizza dough turns out perfect every time and is easy to prepare in 15 minutes with basic ingredients like flour, honey, yeast, and water.
name: Perfect Every Time Pizza or Calzone Dough
recipeIngredient: 3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together 1/2 cup lukewarm water and yeast in a small bowl. Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.

Combine 1/2 cup water, olive oil, honey, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Add 1 cup flour and mix well. Mix yeast mixture into flour mixture. Add remaining flour, 1 cup at a time, until dough is well combined.
Knead dough on a floured work surface until dough is soft, smooth, and elastic, about 8 minutes. Roll dough into 4 calzone shapes or 1 large pizza.

review.reviewBody: I made this does several times, and it is great
Works out great if you tweak values and let it rise.

Used milk instead of water. Delicious soft dough. Played with fillings... Made baked eggplant with Bulgarian cheese. Sweet potato ( prebaked sliced) with kashkaval cheese. Pizza sauce with mushrooms...

Made 4 calzones. Made as per recipe. Nice and quick, everyone enjoyed them! Is this like calzones in Italian restaurant? No, but my boys enjoyed them more. This dough they liked better üôÇ Making them for the 2nd time tonight.

Used the dough hook with the kitchenaid mixer and it was so easy! No need to let it rise, it's good to go straight out of the bowl! Quick and EASY! I wasn't sure if "soft like a horse's nose" described texture or consistency so I probably added too much flour and it still turned out great! You can't get it wrong it's so simple!
I've made this dough so many times and people say thar it's so good and airy.

This recipe is all sorts of wrong and lacking detail. The texture is NOT that of a true calzone or pizza. Recipe does not even mention to let dough rise. Needs more water and less kneading. There are better & authentic, tried, tested, and true recipes online. Save yourself the time and effort and don‚Äôt use this.
Very good
I thought this recipe was perfect, I made chicken calzones and they were perfect! sorry no photo I will add one next time
It was nice soft dough. Worked out perfectly!
Love it. We are retirees so can only make smaller sizes. We made it into 6 and they were still to hig
Super easy to make and the family loved it. We had calzones for lunch and dinner.
Added an extra teaspoon of honey. Made it almost like sweet Italian roll.
Fun to make and great for calzones!

Wasn't very good. Texture was okay, but flavor was bland. My usual dough recipe uses brown sugar, but I thought I would try something different. I will never use this one again. Not sure why it doesn't call for rising after the initial mixing, but maybe that would help (couldn't hurt). I do not recommend.
Excellent calzone dough. I gave it an egg wash and sprinkled some grated parmesan on top before baking. Will definitely make again.
Made this twice now and it is my go to forever. Both times it turned out perfect.
Great pizza dough. Makes two 18‚Äù thin crust pizzas. Easy to roll out. About a quarter cup of extra flour will be needed for hands, roller and table used to roll dough.
Soft as a horses nose makes ZERO sense...... UNTIL!!!! you try this dough. Then it makes perfect sense. It's sweet and soft. Perfect for our calzones.

The dough turned out so nicely for our calzones! The crust baked perfectly and the inside was piping hot...all fresh filling with pork sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, green olives, onions, mozzarella, ricotta and my homemade pizza sauce. Pressed some fresh grated parmesan on top prior to baking. I was able to take a pre-bake photo, but we were all so hungry that the post bake didn‚Äôt happen...next time!
Amazing recipe that makes two large pizzas. Kids pleased, husband pleased and now is our favorite family recipe.

I substituted bread flour so the crust gets a little crispier. I also use 1.75 tsp yeast instead of 1.5 tsp and 3/4 cup of water for the dough (still 1/2 cup with the yeast.) While I do know what a horse‚Äôs nose feels like, I suspect that some folks might not.

Omg this was super easy and sooo good! I mostly followed the recipe except I added 1/2 the honey to the warm water to help the yeast bloom. Also made two pizzas from the recipe as is, next time I might just make one for a real deep dish pizza.
Easiest pizza dough recipe. I‚Äôve always flailed at handling dough and this recipe is failproof.
Looks great and tastes better. THANKS!
I proofed the yeast and warm water with sugar. After mixing the dough i let it double in size for an hour. And i cut it in 8 instead of 4. Turned out pretty good
I made calzones and they were a hit! I used instant yeast and less flour (which I usually do when I use my Bosch). I also brushed the tops with beaten egg before baking. Superb!!!

I just made these and they are delicious. The recipe was easy to follow and the dough was not too bad to work with, however it was more effort than I thought, even using my Kitchen Aid mixer!
Great recipe!

Yah, we loved it. The dough was soft and tasty. We made it into calzones that were baked on a half sheet lined with a silpat. 400* for 15 minutes. Perfect. In the last 3 minutes we brushed a very very light coating of butter across them too and sprinkled parmesan on after out.
Excellent quality dough
I make this recipe often for calzones or pizza. I add garlic butter on top of the calzones with parmesan or mozzarella at the last 5 mins.

I thought this was easy and quick, the only reason I rated this 4 stars is because I used whole wheat instead of white and so it made the texture weird so if you are making this don‚Äôt use whole wheat lol

Good taste and easy to make. Not my preferred texture, but perhaps I should have kneaded it longer. I added garlic powder & dried basil to the dough but couldn't really taste them.I used bread flour, not all purpose flour. Will make it easier again.

Wow! I have made pizza dough and breads for years and wanted to try a different recipe than my go to one. This is amazing. The ratios are perfect and create a very smooth pizza dough. I did not even need extra flour to roll out or to put on my roller. I made this by hand, not machine, and folded it over itself about 25 times to create lots of air pockets for a nice rise.
Thank you so much for posting!
The dough was amazing...
made this recipe and gave me enough for 2 decent sized pizza. dough was on point
This was so easy and really good. Next time I‚Äôll add some seasoning.
Yes, I didn't have any honey, so I put in some corn syrup. Yes I will make it again when I have some honey, I had everything else. Smells good.
This sucked. Fell apart instantly. Too bad I cannot take back the time it took to make this. Gordon Ramsay would be disappointed.
Super easy and very tasty!
Made is x4 for 16 calzone - really easy to work with, had my kids each fill their own.. .super great dough!
I used brown sugar instead of honey. I love this! works better than any pizza dough recipe I have made or bought... I use this all the time.
Replaced the honey with 1 tsp of sugar and added to the warm yeast water to bubble. Baked 4 individual cazolnes at 450 for 13 minutes.
I've added a little bit more sugar to the batter and used vegetable oil instead of olive oil. I also used a tablespoon more of yeast. They turned out great and will be making these again.
Yes, I will make this over and over. It was easy and yummy!!
I didn't make any changes. Made just as the recipe states and we loved it! Dough was tender and nice and crispy. We only made two calzones so I have dough for another time!
Followed the recipe and it came out great, I made it ahead of time and placed it in the refrigerator to keep it from rising, I used it with my new calzone maker and they came out nice and crispy.
Super easy dough and no rise time needed. I knead it by hand till it was nice and stretchy

This recipe is a keeper. I worked in a family owned pizza parlor during my early college years and this very closely resembles the flavor of the good old days. Great recipe to bring back great memories!

Besides using coconut oil (I was out of olive) & leaving it for a few minutes to rise because I had some stuff to do, I followed the recipe exactly as is and i have no regrets. It was sooo delicious. Restaurant quality I tell you! Thank you do much for this.

This is not my favorite tasting dough, but I‚Äôm rating it based on ease and speed, which is what it touts. I used for 1 Stromboli and it was a little more dough than I needed. I will use recipe again only if I‚Äôm in a pinch.

Followed recipe to the T. Had to ad a little more H2O in order to get right consistency. Delicious, light airy crust. I baked at 475 for 10 minutes but I think my oven is out of whack so keep close eye on it so you don't burn it. Super easy and fun to make

If you don't use sugar to cure the yeast pre-mixing, it cuts the too sweet. I added powdered garlic to the dough, knowing I was using it for individual calzones for a potluck dinner's main course: pepperoni; sausage and bell pepper; ham; spinach; mushroom and tomato; and plain eight cheese calzones. Even the six year olds complimented the meal! Served with burgundy wine marinara on the side.
This was perfect!
So easy and fast and even more exciting, delicious. Our new go-to pizza dough recipe. Next time we will add basil or oregano just to spice it up, but we loved it!
Absolutely PERFECT each and every time. I like this recipe for pizza dough or bread sticks. Cooks beautifully. No adjustments needed.
A good quick dough for pizza! Thanks for the recipe.
Made the dough way ahead of time. Put it in the fridge for 4 hours. Made a beautiful pizza. Won't be buying it any more. Very good texture and flavor. We all loved it.

This is my go-to recipe. The only change I make is doubling the recipe to feed 6 hungry folks. I let it proof either o the counter or in the fridge for 24-48 hours and you absolutely cannot beat the flavor. Make sure you‚Äôre using honey and a good olive oil. Totally worth it!

I pretty much follow the directions except I add the full one cup of warm water. My family loves it. I always bake my pizzas or calzones on a puzzle stone. Perfect every time and I always get compliments on how yummy it is!

The best I have ever tried! Most of the homemade crust recipes I've tried were tasteless and brittle, but this one has great taste and texture! Easy to make. I only used 1 tbsp of honey because I added 1/2 tbsp of sugar to the yeast and water. I make this crust a couple times a month and would gladly pass it on to someone if they were looking for an awesome pizza crust recipe!
My family didn't boycott it but overall reaction was that it was too sweet.
made this into a pizza. Tasted like cardboard. Won't be making again.
Great dough. Makes at least two medium pizzas. I made one and it was way too thick.
We just didn't like this. The flavor was odd and the texture wasn't to our liking.

This is a very good dough, it can be used for several different items.
I will be using this one alot!

Very easy to make. I doubled the recipe and was able to make 4 large pizzas. I used the dough hook on my mixer to mix and get to a ball. Then I kneaded by hand until smooth. I did add 1tsp garlic powder and 2 tsp oregano. I will definitely use this recipe again.
Best pizza dough I've ever made.. This recipe will be my go to dough recipe from now on
Finished raw dough product was easy to work with, good elasticity. Used it for pizza, baked texture was great, taste was bland. I'll make this again but next time throw in some herbs.
I would make this again, didn't have any honey. It was good for the first time making dough.
Tastes better than the pizza dough bought locally and it is simple to make!

Yum! 
This makes me miss Fresh and Easy and their pizza dough balls a little bit less. Their whole wheat was the BEST, I'm trying this recipe next with whole wheat flour.
I put cilantro and garlic salt IN the crust, and then made bbq chicken pizza.
Also, sprinkling just a little cornmeal on the pizza stone or pizza pan under the dough gives it that extra salty zing.

Great recipe!!! delicious!!! When I make pizza with this recipe I usually have to cook it about 30-35 minutes at 400degrees. maybe I'm putting too many toppings though? anyways, this recipe is awesome.
I'm going to try it with a little ale in place of the water
We followed the recipe as stated and it was perfect! We used it to make four medium calzones and had enough left over to make a pizza.

We had impromptu company so I didn't have time to make dough in the bread maker. I've never kneaded dough, so I put on some reggae and went to town for the 8 minutes it suggests. I'm not sure if it was as soft as a horse's nose, but the finished result was beautiful! I rolled it out with a rolling pin a little larger than the round pan, placed in to the pan, and rolled the edges to match the pan. It turned out just like a delivery pizza! I brushed it with olive oil and pre-cooked it for 5 minutes, added toppings, and cooked for another 20 min. Perfect! Loved this!
Quick and easy.....and good! Cut flour to 2 1/2 cups otherwise made as the recipe

My first attempt at homemade pizza dough and it came out great! I used the dough hook on my Kitchen Aid for the mixing and kneading so it was super simple. The only change I made was to exchange one cup of white flour for whole wheat.
Best pizza dough ever!
I have been making homemade pizzas for few years now. The dough turned out surprisingly very soft with this recipe. I made Calzones and they turned out great. This is my new go-to recipe now!
Very easy to make, and tastes great. I use it for calzone dough and have not had a single complaint.
Amazing crust. The only thing I did different is put the yeast in my flour- stirred and then added the liquids, homemade pizza in under an hour

Made with bread flour and it was great. I added the ingredients to my bread machine and let it mix and knead the dough, refrigerated it in an oiled bowl overnight, then made breakfast pizza the next morning. I have tried tons of different recipes for homemade pizza, and I just deleted all of them. This one is a keeper.

Cooked up a great pizza, my three yr old has been taking an hour to eat anything lately and even he gobbled up his portion of cheese pizza in no time. Had onion, olives, garlic and mushroom on mom n dads side, mom absolutely loved it and wants me to make it again soon.

I love this recipe. It's quick, easy and tastes fantastic. The honey gives the dough a hint of sweetness. I made calzones and took the advise of others by adding herbs into the dough. I like a sweet and salty taste, so I'm going to try a gentle sprinkling of sea salt over the tops before baking next time. I will definitely be making this again and again.
GREAT recipe! I was easily able to increase the recipe in order to use it to make stromboli for 200 kids!
it was good

I made it for the first time and made bread sticks, turn out great. Now I'm ready to try pizza and calzones. Works up fast and easy. Only one problem, I could have eaten the entire batch! Glad I had some help with them, everyone enjoyed them. Next time I will try brushing on some butter and a bit of garlic salt.

I've made this many times by hand following the recipe exactly as written. It isn't perfectly textured, but it is super easy, fast, and delicious. I pre-bake the crust at 425 for about 5-6 minutes, then add toppings and bake for another 8-10 minutes. I make homemade pizza at least one weeknight a week, so thank you very much for posting this recipe - it's been a huge timesaver and a nice treat for everyone.
I followed the recipe and made the dough in my kitchen aid mixer. I used this calzone dough recipe to make a taco braid. Turned out amazing and super yummy!
Perfect, great taste, great texture. I only used 2 and 1/2 cups of flour. I also used a 1/2 tablespoon sugar to proof the yeast (1/2 cup water at 110 degrees).

Nice recipe and very versatile. Pizza, calzones, bread sticks. The method works and the ratio of water to flour is good. Depending on the humidity where you live, you may need a little more or less flour. 
I used my stand mixer, for mixing and kneading. Very easy. Thanks for a solid recipe.

item.name: Perfect Every Time Pizza or Calzone Dough
